utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi, good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is tour guide %uh number one And my name is Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how do I address you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm %uh participant number twenty and my name is %uh John.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: John?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi John.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh hi Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, yes and how can I help you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, %uh I would like to inquire about %uh travelling to Singapore for about two to three days with my wife.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I need to %uh, you know, take her on a short vacation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is this your first trip to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, this will be my first trip to Singapore and I'm %uh excited to go there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So first things first, I %uh want to %uh check on the budget friendly hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if you can recommend some hotels that I can afford.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what would be %uh the price range that you are talking about?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, maybe I can give you %uh indication of the hotel prices here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %uh let say about a hundred fifty right to two hundred dollars or two hundred to three hundred dollars budget range.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, maybe %uh if I would be staying for around two to three days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we have %uh- so which price range are we talking about?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The hundred %uh and fifty to two hundred or slightly above two hundred to three hundred price range?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, something around a hundred to one hundred fifty a day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh and would you like something right in the heart of the shopping belt or you don't or you prefer something in %uh the residential area in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I would prefer something like in the commercial district where I can walk around and %uh take a look at the sceneries and, you know.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh just walking from one place to another would be good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And, yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Walking from one place to another?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So commercial district meaning %um more towards the shopping belt rather than the business district, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um there are some interesting hotels there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh one of the hotels that I would be able to recommend you %uh would be the Rendezvous Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Rendezvous Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how much %uh they %uh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What is the price for this hotel, is it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, how much are the %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we are looking approximately about just slightly over two hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The prices for- %Hm that's quite expensive, but I can %uh consider that one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Rendezvous Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, because it's just walking to most of the %uh places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's in the heart of the Singapore Commercial District?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise there is another hotel %uh call the Grand Park Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Grand Park Hotel, so I can also check on this one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What are the rates for the Grand Park Hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I've s~ Sorry, the price range is around two hundred.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two hun~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Slightly below two hundred a night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two hundred a day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that would- this will be there %uh regular suites.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, %uh a standard room.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A standard room %uh for one room.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, yah, so this is the price range %uh for the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And if there is a nearby restaurants within that hotel, so if you could recommend some good restaurants like selling Singaporean delicacies.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Local Singaporean delicacy so maybe we could some out of those dishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh in this hotel itself, %uh they have a restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, they have a restaurant in this particular hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And yes they do serve some of our cuisine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise I would also recommend to you %uh just about ten minutes' walk from the Rendezvous hotel, %um you'll be able to get to One Fullerton.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: One Fullerton.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes and there is a restaurant there that serve a unique Singapore %uh food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: One Fullerton Hotel, alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh maybe I can write that down and check on that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, it's called One Fullerton.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so %uh there is a seafood restaurant

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and of course a lot of people, including the locals, like to eat %uh chili crab.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Chili crab.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What are the other delicacies %uh Singapore is known for?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: except for the chili crabs

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh what other delicacy, is it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, because we are multiracial here so we do have like the Malay cuisine, %uh the Chinese, the Indian.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have another %uh food that is also a favourite of a lot people is called peranakan food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What's that again, peranakan?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's in-short it will be a Chinese style of cooking %uh but using %uh more Malay %uh spices.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you like spicy food or most Singaporean foods are spicy?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I wouldn't say most Singapore %uh food are spicy it's these are just different cuisines %uh that we have in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So yes, but yes a lot of %uh Singapore people like to eat spicy food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And going back to the hotel, %uh if you could recommend some, you know, local attractions like park %uh nearby zoos, museums, where people, you know, usually go from just walking around or like- I know Singapore is known for their %uh the trains.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if you have nearby %uh attractions like what I mention earlier, is there any nearby parks, any zoos?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: To-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: From the hotel, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: From the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, from Rendezvous Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From Rendezvous Hotel, you can %uh walk to- or I would say either you walk or you take this MRT train from %uh City Hall and you alight at Raffles Place MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will be alighting and walking just above five minutes to the %uh Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so what can I see on %uh Marina Bay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, it's a beautiful bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um you will be able to see %uh the bay front which is very pretty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course the Marina Bay Sands Resort, as well as the icon of Singapore, we call it the Merlion Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the Merlion is the %uh ti~ %uh lion head with a fish tail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so that is the %um good photo %uh stops %uh for you to take some memories of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do that, just walking distance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From- or just %uh one stop away from your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- So that's the Marina Bay?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how many kilometres %uh is that exactly from the Rendezvous Hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh walking kilometres, approximately about %uh five kilometres.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would think %uh taking the train would be a better idea.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Except for Marina Bay, what else %uh attractions can you recommend for me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh would you want to see %uh just tourist sports?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, anything that it can be %uh, you know, looking forward to see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay in around the Merli~ %uh the Marina Bay %uh it's also a wa~ a nice walk because %uh you are just walking around the bay front.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh like I said it has interesting skyline, there are some interesting sculptures %uh along the Marina Bay area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and in the night time, %uh we do have a show that is %um, you don't have to pay for this show, at the Marina Bay front.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a laser water show %uh on the Marina Bay itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But that only comes on in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there is a very interesting museum on Marina Bay as well, it's called the Arts and Science Museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I also like to acquire on- %uh go to some of your museums.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what is that again?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: what's

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Arts and Science Museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Art and Science Museum, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Arts and Science Museum %uh in the Marina Bay, okay so-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- So it's inside the Marina Bay or it's beyond or it's just %uh walking distance from the Marina Bay itself?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it is actually just next door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The %um building itself is shaped like a lotus flower.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now I'm showing you %uh how this Arts and Science Museum looks like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: it shaped like %uh a lotus flower.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the Arts and Science %uh Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So everything dedicated to Arts and Science and of course at certain time, %uh %eh we have special exhibit, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The last exhibit was the %uh Titanic Exhibition.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this is actually a world-class exhibition.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And earlier on you mention %uh you also want to do the zoo as well, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, we can also consider %um going to some zoo parks.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, the zoo will be located in the Northwest of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and in this zoo, you will see our largest collection of the Orang-utan.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well going back to the hotel from the Rendezvous Hotel,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, how many kilometres %uh from the hotel to that zoo?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh approximately about twenty kilometres.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So should I take the MRT again?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you will take the MRT from City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You take the North line and you alight at %uh Ang Mo Kio Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there, %uh you would take a bus to go

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will go- yah yes and you take a bus to the %uh zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The Singapore Zoo?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, this is open in the daytime.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: In the daytime only?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what time do they usually open?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the park actually opens at eight A.M. in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And up to what time?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh six P.M.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, six P.M. The Singapore Zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, this is the Singapore Zoo and you will see %uh mammals in this zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so %uh like I said %uh lots of %uh is- we have the largest collection of the Orang-utans.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is a show in the zoo %uh that you can watch.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the show varies from the time of the year or it always frequent the zoo?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: They always have some shows there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, no, it goes on every day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, every day we have this show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the morning %uh it will be eleven o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And in the afternoon it will be four P.M.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, my kids will %uh definitely love to see those animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so this is the %uh show which is interesting, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But our show is not like the circus kind of show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It just %uh shows you, yah, what the animals %uh do, alright, %uh in the wild as well %uh what they do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, and by the way %uh by taking the MRT train, %uh how much is the %uh usual fare that they %uh- that I need %uh to purchase?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will buy your ticket from the MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We would have a ticket, a few ticket machines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you will, they will tell you where- which location you are now at and you just tell them- you just press the button which destination you are going to stop, and the machine will tell you how much to %uh- %uh how much is the fare.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you just have to use Singapore money to purchase your ticket.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how much usu~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The machine will als~ yes, so it all depends on %uh where you're taking from and where you are going to stop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the price range will range from a dollar forty cents %uh right up to two dollars and twenty cents.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: per person.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Dollar and twenty cents.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So going back to the Rendezvous Hotel again, %uh is there any more interesting place %uh beyond the vicinity of that hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, beyond the vicinity of the hotel of course there are shopping areas on Orchard Road %uh and then you walk to the Merlion Park or you take the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise you can %uh walk to the museum, we have the National Museum out there, the %uh Singapore Arts Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or do you want to consider doing ethnic places in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, yes %uh maybe I can consider going to an ethnic place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which ethnic place do you want me to recommend?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which ethnic place would you want me to recommend?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Anything.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is it-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, anything just beyond, you know, the vicinity of the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh would I be able to introduce %uh you %uh to the Indian quarters?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Indian quarters?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A traditional Indian place where the Indians when they came to Singapore, most of them live in this area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have preserved this area and we call it Little India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay, it's like a Chinatown where the- do Chinese lives and this place is the Indian place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have another area called Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh this other place would be called Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there is another Malay area call Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Malay you means like %uh the Malaysians?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well the Malays in Singapore of course %uh the- some of them were native in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but our- some of the Malay ancestors came from the nearby %uh countries of Malaysia, as well as Indonesia.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we would call %eh and of course %uh, yah, the nearby islands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Generally we call this area the Malay Archipelo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Malay Archipelo, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so %uh but of course the people here, who are Malay, and if they are locals here, they would have been born here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh most of the people here would be third generation %uh Singaporeans.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Their ancestors will probably come from the nearby countries for the Malays.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe on my second day at Singapore %uh I would prefer to transfer to another hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe like the first one is on %uh the business district.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe you could %um provide me some information on the province like surroundings?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like in the city any more.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, sorry, I don't understand you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe you could provide additional information like %uh if I will travel or transfer to another hotel, %uh maybe you could provide some suggestion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not on the commercial district, but on the somehow provincial ones.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Provincial as in the residential area?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, maybe at the residential area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, there is %uh hotel called %uh the Link Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I- L I N K. And it is located in %uh a residential area, a very old residential area %uh call Tiong Bahru.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is also a very accessible location, because there is the MRT %uh that is located %um just about less than ten minutes' walk to the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the M- So the MRT passes by this area also?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, about ten minutes' walk from this hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So or if you look at the %uh photograph?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The first photograph of the front facade of the hotel, %uh this was originally residential area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a building that is originally residential but they have now been converted to a hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, and do you recommend %uh ano- %uh an attraction %uh nearby this hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And what are the rates on this hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the attractions near to this hotel like I mention %uh this is in a residential area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you would be %um going to a market, alright, that opens in the morning from %uh seven thirty to twelve o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this market is what we call a wet market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they will sell fish, meat, fruits, vegetable in this market sold.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will be meeting a lot of local people %uh when you visit the market.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's something I would say interesting %uh because these are not the normal %uh tourist site.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you get- when you stay in this hotel, you get to interact with a lot of the local because majority of the people that you meet %uh around your hotel area would be local.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I think- Okay, so this is not %uh your popular tourist destination in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I wouldn't say it's not the normal tourist belt, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you are %uh located in an area %uh that is very much residential.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But this a nice %uh boutique hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, what are the rates in this hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, %uh the rates %uh of course again it depending sometimes they do have promotions %uh in %uh certain %uh during certain dates.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, but it should be in the range of about two hundred %uh dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Per day?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two hundred to-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, per day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Per day meaning %uh from let say today it's starts at two o'clock or three o'clock to the next day %uh check out eleven or twelve o'clock the next day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, so I'd like to get one of the promotions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so %uh again we have to see whether let say if you're going to arrive

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, it still in the price range of about two hundred.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it is a nice %uh small hotel %uh not that big hotel and it just walk ten minutes or less, %uh to the main %uh Orchard Road shopping area.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: And of course we have a lot more other interesting museums for example war museums in Singapore, we have %uh nice parks %uh Wetland Parks, if you like something and you get wet.
